page.title: 11THE CHURCH
page.content: There has been a church in Witheridge since 900 years ago , but little of it remains.The present church was built about 1428 , and it is called St John the Baptist church.On the outside of the church there's a scratch-dial which isn't very common. In the church yard there are rhymes on grave stones , really old trees , crosses , children's graves and different shaped graves with angels on. Inside the church there is an angel shaped lectern holding a bible.Also there is a pulpit in the church which has St Peter holding some keys , St Paul holding a sword and bible , Jesus being crucified with Mary and John by him and two more unnamed saints.There was a tower known for its strength with a spire attached to it , but it got taken because lightning struck it.
